sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含"为……提供理由或根据"之意。
means: justify ： 强调所提供的根据或理由不仅会迎合理性还满足了良心，并且含"如果不提供理由辨护就会受到非难"的意味。
warrant ： 指有充分的理由或有必要做某事。

sentence.Network_en: The allegations are serious enough to warrant an investigation.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些指控很严重，有必要进行一番调查。

sentence.Network_en: Officers armed with a search warrant entered the flat.
sentence.Network_cn: 警察们持搜查证进入了那所公寓。

sentence.Network_en: By accusing the King of murder, he signed his own death warrant.
sentence.Network_cn: 他指控国王谋杀，从而让自己走上了绝路。

jx.jx_en_mean: (dated)used to express the speaker's certainty about a fact or situation

lj.lj_ly: I'll warrant you'll thank me for it in years to come.
lj.lj_ls: 我敢说，几年之后你会感激我的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the senses 'protector' and 'safeguard', also, as a verb, 'keep safe from danger'): from variants of Old French guarant (noun), guarantir (verb), of Germanic origin; compare with guarantee

entry.def: If something warrants a particular action, it makes the action seem necessary or appropriate for the circumstances.

example.ex: The allegations are serious enough to warrant an investigation...
example.tran: 这些指控很严重，有必要进行一番调查。

example.ex: No matter was too small to warrant his attention.
example.tran: 再小的事也会引起他的注意。

entry.def: A warrant is a legal document that allows someone to do something, especially one that is signed by a judge or magistrate and gives the police permission to arrest someone or search their house.

example.ex: Police confirmed that they had issued a warrant for his arrest.
example.tran: 警方证实他们已经签发了对他的拘捕令。

entry.def: If you say that there is no warrant for something, you mean that there is no good reason to justify it.

example.ex: There is some warrant for holding back on full-scale aid.
example.tran: 有理由不进行全面援助。

entry.def: If you warrant that something is true or will happen, you say officially that it is true, or guarantee that it will happen.

example.ex: All entrants must warrant that their entry is entirely their own work...
example.tran: 所有参赛者必须保证其参赛作品完全是自己创作的。

example.ex: The contract warrants that an experienced person is on board all the time.
example.tran: 合同确保一位富有经验的人会一直呆在船上。

means.word_mean: 1. a writ from a court commanding police to perform specified acts
2. a type of security issued by a corporation (usually together with a bond or preferred stock) that gives the holder the right to purchase a certain amount of common stock at a stated price;

sentences.sentence: "as a sweetener they offered warrants along with the fixed-income securities"
"a Democrat usually gets the union's endorsement"

means.word_mean: 4. a written assurance that some product or service will be provided or will meet certain specifications
1. show to be reasonable or provide adequate ground for;

sentences.sentence: "The emergency does not warrant all of us buying guns"

means.word_mean: 2. stand behind and guarantee the quality, accuracy, or condition of;

sentences.sentence: "The dealer warrants all the cars he sells"

example.en: Look like that's the death warrant for our plan.
example.zh: 看来那就是我们计划的致命缺陷。

auth_sentence.content: The ICC has a warrant out for his arrest.
auth_sentence.res_content: The ICC has a warrant out for his arrest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The ICC has a warrant out for his arrest.

auth_sentence.content: A travel-warrant...authorising them to impress transport and requisition billets.
auth_sentence.res_content: A travel-warrant...authorising them to impress transport and requisition billets.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A travel-warrant...authorising them to impress transport and requisition billets.

auth_sentence.content: It...had enough shortcomings to warrant junking the whole idea.
auth_sentence.res_content: It...had enough shortcomings to warrant junking the whole idea.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It...had enough shortcomings to warrant junking the whole idea.

sentences.en: I will warrant him an honest and reliable fellow.
sentences.cn: 我可以保证他是一个诚实可靠的人。

jushi.english: This tiny crowd doesn't warrant such a large police presence.
jushi.chinese: 没有理由出动这么多的警察来对付这一小群人。

jushi.english: His wealth doesn't warrant his rude behaviour.
jushi.chinese: 他的富有并不能证明他的无礼行为是正当的。
